'''Gebran Bassil''' is a Lebanese politician. He is also the son-in-law of former general [[Michel Aoun]] and a member of his [[March 8 Alliance]]-backed [[Free Patriotic Movement]]. He served as the Minister of Telecommunications in the Lebanese cabinet from May 2008 to June 2009, and then served as Minister of Energy in the [[Lebanese government of November 2009|government]] headed by [[Saad Hariri]] before he issued the statement that March 8 would quit the government.<ref>{{Citation | magazine = The Lebanese Presidency | url = http://www.presidency.gov.lb/PhotoGallery/Pages/NewsDetails.aspx?NewsRef=3077 |accessdate=November 11, 2009}}</ref>

'''Gebran Bassil''' ({{lang-ar|Ø¬Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ù Ø¨Ø§Ø³ÙÙ}}) is a Lebanese politician. He is also the son-in-law of former general [[Michel Aoun]] and a member of his [[March 8 Alliance]]-backed [[Free Patriotic Movement]]. He served as the Minister of Telecommunications in the Lebanese cabinet from May 2008 to June 2009, and then served as Minister of Energy in the [[Lebanese government of November 2009|government]] headed by [[Saad Hariri]] before he issued the statement that March 8 would quit the government.<ref>{{Citation | magazine = The Lebanese Presidency | url = http://www.presidency.gov.lb/PhotoGallery/Pages/NewsDetails.aspx?NewsRef=3077 |accessdate=November 11, 2009}}</ref>
